Name of Invention: Evidence that Earth has a core
Synthesis of ammonia from its elements
Boundary between Earth's crust and mantle identified
Discovery of Burgess Shale: ancient invertebrate fossils
First mapping of a gene to a chromosome
First steps in elucidating chemical transmission of nerve impulses: neurotransmitters
Synthesis of genetics with the theory of evolution by natural selection (neodarwinism)
Matrix and wave formulations of quantum mechanics
Matter is proved to be wavelike
First suggestion that Earth's magnetic field reverses
Establishment of the scientific study of animal behavior
Discovery of the positron first antimatter particle
Discovery of the citric acid cycle
Evidence in bacteria that DNA is the genetic material
Start of Mexican wheat improvement program leading to the "green revolution"
Formulation of the one-gene one-enzyme hypothesis
Initial elucidation of the reactions involved in photosynthesis
Big Bang theory for origin of the Universe
Presentation of the idea of gene transposition: "jumping genes"
Production of amino acids in "early Earth" conditions
First determination of the amino-acid sequence of a protein
Structure of DNA: the double helix
Quantum tunneling of electrons in semiconductors
Discoveries of fossils of early Homo in East Africa
Explanation for magnetic stripes on the sea floor: seafloor spreading
Genetic explanations proposed for animal social behavior
Discovery of cosmic microwave background radiation
First warning of an anthropogenic "greenhouse effect"
Electroweak theory first unification of fundamental forces
Proposal that certain cell organelles are descended from free-living bacteria
Identification of CFCs as threat to ozone layer
First Grand Unified Theory of particle physics
Patch-clamp technique for studying single ion channels
First complete DNA sequence of an organism
Unveiling of genetic controls on animal body-plan development
Impact hypothesis for extinctions at the Cretaceous-Tertiary boundary
Formulation of the "Out of Africa" hypothesis of human evolution using molecular data
Dolly the sheep created by cloning
Publication of near-complete sequences of the human genome
Name of Inventor: International Human Genome Sequencing Consortium; Venter et al.
